turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: They're gonna hafta take their chances.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What does that mean, exactly? Take their chances.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: It means that they will be at risk from whale hunters -- same as the rest of the humpbacks.  What did you mean when you said all that stuff back at the Institute about extinction?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: No, ma'am. No dipshit.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Well, that's something. I'da let you off right here.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: All right. Who are you? and don't jerk me around any more. I want to know how you know that.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: We can't tell you.  Please, just -- let me finish. I can tell you that we're not in the military and that we intend no harm to the whales.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Then --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: In fact, we may be able to help -- in ways that, frankly, you couldn't possibly imagine.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Or believe, I'll bet.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Very likely. You're not exactly catching us at our best.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Just a little joke. See you later, old friend.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: How did you know Gracie's pregnant? Nobody knows that.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: He's just going to hang around the bushes while we eat?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: It's his way.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Do you trust me?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Implicitly.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Good.  A large mushroom and pepperoni with extra onions. And a Michelob.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: So how did a nice girl like you get to be a cetacean biologist?

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Just lucky, I guess.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You're upset about losing the whales.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: ... You're very perceptive.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: How will that be done, exactly?

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: They'll be flown in a special 747 to Alaska and released there.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Flown... And that's the last you'll see of them?

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: See, yes. But we'll tag them with radio transmitters on a special frequency so we can keep tabs on them.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You know, I could take those whales somewhere they wouldn't be hunted.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: You? You can't even get from Sausalito to San Francisco without a lift.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Thanks. Cheers.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: If you have such a low opinion of my abilities, how come we're having dinner?

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: I told you: I'm a sucker for hard luck cases. Besides, I want to know why you travel around with that ditzy guy who knows that Gracie is pregnant and calls you Admiral.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Where could you take them?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Hm?

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: My whales? Where could you take them where they'd be safe?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: It's not so much a matter of a place as of time.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Sorry, the time would have to be right now.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What do you mean now?

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Let's just say that no humpback born in captivity has ever survived.  Problem is, they won't be a whole lot safer at sea because of all the hunting this time of year... So that, as they say, is that.  Damn.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: What's that?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What's what?

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: You got a pocket pager? What are you, a doctor?

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Wanna try it from the top?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Tell me when the whales are going to be released?

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: ... Who are you?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Who do you think I am?

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Don't tell me: you're from outer space.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: No, I'm from Iowa. I just work in outer space.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Well, I was close. I knew outer space was going to come into it sooner or later.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: All right. The truth?

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: I'm all ears.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: That's what you think.  Okay...Truth... I'm from what, on your calendar, would be the late 23rd Century. I've been sent back in time to bring two Humpback Whales with me in an attempt to... repopulate the species.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Well, why didn't you say so? Why all the coy disguises?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You want the details?

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Are you kidding? I wouldn't miss this for all the tea in China.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Then tell me when the whales are leaving.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Jesus, you are persistent.  Okay, your friend was right. Gracie is not only pregnant, she is very pregnant... At noon tomorrow -- in what is sure to be a media circus -- the whales get shipped out.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Noon tomorrow...?!

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Well, "Admiral," that may be the strangest dinner of my life and the biggest cockamamie fish story I've ever heard.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You asked.  Now, will you tell me something?  George and Gracie's transmitter. What's the frequency?

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Sorry, that's classified.  I don't really have a clue who you are... You wouldn't want to show me around your space ship, would you?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: It wouldn't be my first choice, no.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: So. There we are.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Lemme tell you something. I'm here to bring two humpbacks into the 23rd Century. If I have to, I'll go to the open sea to get them, but I'd just as soon take yours -- better for me, better for you... and better for them.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: I bet you're a damn good poker player.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Think about it -- but don't take too long because I'm out of time. If you change your mind, this is where I'll be.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Here... In the park?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Right.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: It's true... what you said...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Yes... And I'm glad you're here. Though I'll admit, you picked a hellova time to drop in...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Steady, now. We need your help.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Have I flipped out? ... Is any of this real?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: It's all real. Look.  The storage tanks for the whales.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: But Kirk...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: We'll bring them up just like we brought you. It's called a transporter beam...

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Kirk. They're gone.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: ... Gone?!

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: They were taken last night. I wasn't told. They're in Alaska by now.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: ... Damn!

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: What kind of spaceship is this, anyway?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: A spaceship with a missing man.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: If we keep going up, they'll catch us!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Calm yourself, Nurse.  Scotty, get us out of here!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Gillian... Would the whales be at sea by now?

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Yes... If you have a chart on board, I can show you.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: All I need is the radio frequency to track them.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: What are you talking about? I'm coming with you.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You can't. Our next stop is the 23rd Century.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: What do I care? I've got nobody but those whales...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I have no time to argue, Gillian. Or even tell you how much you've meant to us... The <u>frequency</u>.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: All right. The frequency is 401 megahertz.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Thank you. For everything.  Beam me up, Scotty.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You tricked me.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: You need me.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Oh my God, we're too late!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Sulu: full power descent!

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: ... What does that mean?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: He means our chances of getting home are not very good. You might have lived a longer life if you'd stayed where you belong.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: I belong here.  Suppose by some miracle you do get them through.  Who in the 23rd Century knows anything about Humpback whales?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: ... You have a point...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Hey! -- Where you going?!

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: You're going to your ship, I'm going to mine. Science Vessel. I've got 300 years of catch-up learning to do.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You mean this is -- goodbye?

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Why does it have to be goodbye?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Well, I... As they say in your century -- I don't even have your phone number. How will I find you?

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Don't worry. I'll find <u>you</u>.  See you around the galaxy...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Permission to come aboard.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Permission granted.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Thank you, Admiral.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Jim, Spock, Jim. Remember...?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: It would be improper to refer to you as Jim while you are in command, Admiral... Also, I must apologize for my attire.  I seem to have misplaced my uniform.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Well, I... find that understandable  I mean, you've been through a lot.  Station, please.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock -- you're suggesting the transmission is meant for life form other than man?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: A distinct possibility, Admiral. The President did say the transmission was directed at the Earth's Oceans

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Uhura... Can you modify the Probe's signals by accounting for density temperature and salinity factors?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Where are you going?!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: To the on-board computer room. To confirm my suspicion.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock...?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: As suspected, the Probe's transmissions are the songs sung by whales.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Whales?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock, could the Humpback's answer to this call be simulated?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: The sounds, but not the language. We would be responding in gibberish.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Is there any other planet where this species exists?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: The Humpback was indigenous to Earth. Earth of the past.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: That leaves us no choice. We must destroy the probe before it destroys Earth.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: That would be futile, Admiral. The probe would neutralize us easily.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: But we can't turn away! Is there no alternative?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: There is one, but I cannot guarantee its success. We could attempt to find some Humpback Whales.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Spock, your computations?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: In progress, Admiral.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Uhura. Get me through to Starfleet Command.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Ready to engage computer, Admiral.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What is our target in time?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: The late 20th Century.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Surely you can be more specific...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Not with this equipment. I have had to program some of the variables from memory.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What are the variables...?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Availability of fuel components; Mass of the vessel through a time continuum, and the probable location of Humpbacks, in this case, the Pacific basin.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You've programmed that from memory...?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I have.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Earth... But when?... Spock?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Judging by the pollution content of the atmosphere, I believe we have arrived at the late 20th Century.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Well done, Mr. Spock.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Home in on the strongest signal. Descend from orbit.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Admiral, if I may: we're probably already visible to the tracking devices of the time.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Quite right, Spock. Mr. Chekov, engage cloaking device!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: There is a 20th Century possibility.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Explain.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: If memory serves, there was a dubious flirtation with nuclear fission reactors resulting in toxic side effects. By the beginning of the fusion era, these reactors had been replaced, but at this time, we should be able to find some.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: But you said toxic.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: We could rig a device to collect their high energy photons safely; we could then inject the photons into the dilithium chamber, causing crystalline restructure.... Theoretically.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Where would we find these reactors... Theoretically.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Nuclear power was widely used in naval vessels...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Weren't those a birthday present from Dr. McCoy?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: And they will be again, Spock. That's the beauty of it.  How much?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Well, Spock, thanks to your restored memory and a little bit of luck, we are in the streets of San Francisco looking for a pair of humpback whales.  How do you propose to solve this minor problem?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Simple logic will suffice. We need a map.  That one should do.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I think we'll find what we're looking for at the Cetacean Institute in Sausalito. Two Humpbacks called George and Gracie.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: How do you know this...?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: ... Simple logic.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: As you observed, a primitive Culture.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Admiral, may I ask you a question?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock, don't call me Admiral. Don't you remember: you used to call me Jim... Now what's your question?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Your use of language has altered since our arrival. It is currently laced with -- shall I say -- more colorful metaphors: "Double dumb ass on you" -- and so forth...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You mean profanity. That's simply the way they talk here. Nobody pays any attention to you if you don't swear every other word. You'll find it in all the literature of the period.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: For example?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Oh, the complete works of Jacqueline Susan, the novels of Harold Robbins....

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Ah... The giants.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Come on, fellah -- speak up!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Admiral, if we were to assume these. whales are ours to do with as we please, we would be as guilty as those who caused their extinction.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Yes?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: About those colorful metaphors we discussed. I don't think you should try to use them.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Why not?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Well, for one thing, you haven't quite got the hang of it.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I see.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: And another thing... It is not always necessary to tell the truth.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I cannot tell a lie.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You don't have to lie... You could exaggerate.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Exaggerate.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You've done it before. Can't you remember?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: The hell I can't

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What else did you learn from your mind meld?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: They are very unhappy about the way their species has been treated by man.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: They have a right to be...  Do you think they'll help us?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I believe I was successful in communicating our intentions.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: ... I see.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: It's her -- from the Institute. If we play our cards right, we may learn when those whales are really leaving.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: How will playing cards help?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I meant --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: He meant what you were saying on the tour: that if things keep on the way they're going, humpbacks will disappear forever.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Status?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: The tank will be finished by morning...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: That's cutting it closer than you know. What about team two?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: No word since beam-in. We can only wait for their call.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Damn.... Damnit! We've been so lucky. We have the two perfect whales in our hands, but if we don't move quickly, we'll lose them!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: In that event, the probabilities are that our mission would fail.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Our <u>mission</u>! Goddam it, Spock, you're talking about the end of every life on Earth! You're half human, haven't you got any goddamned feelings about <u>that</u>!!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Admiral. Full power is restored.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Thank you, Spock.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Admiral, may I suggest that Dr. McCoy is correct. We must help Chekov.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Is that the logical thing to do, Spock...?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: No, Admiral... But is the human thing to do.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Right.  Will you help us?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Spock, where the hell is the power you promised me?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Admiral, you must wait one damn minute.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Sulu, take the con. I'm taking our guest down to see her whales.  Mr. Spock: have you accounted for the variable mass of whales and water in your time re-entry program?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Mr. Scott cannot give me exact figures, Admiral. So I will...  Make a <u>guess</u>.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: <u>You?</u>  Spock, that's extraordinary.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Can we make breakaway speed!?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Hardly, Admiral, I cannot even guarantee we will escape the Sun's gravity! I will attempt to compensate by altering our trajectory.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock... Did braking thrusters fire?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: They did, Admiral.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Then... Where the hell are we?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock: Condition report!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: No data, Admiral. Computers are non-functional.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You got us to the right place, Spock. Now all we have to do is get the whales out before we <u>sink</u>.  Mr. Scott, come in!... Scotty...?!  Damn... Mr. Spock, see to the safety of all hands.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I will, Admiral.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Guidance is functional. Onboard Computer will interface with Federation memory bank...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Weapons systems?

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Estimating Planet Earth one point six hours present speed.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Continue on course. Chekov, any signs of Federation escort?

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Warp two... three...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Steady as she goes...

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Warp Nine... Nine point two... Nine point three...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Sulu, we need breakaway speed!

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Hang on, sir... Nine point seven... point eight... Breakaway threshold...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Steady!!...  Now, Mr. Sulu!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Sulu...? ... Mr. Sulu?!

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: ... Aye sir...?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What is our condition?

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Sir... Braking thrusters seem to have fired.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Picture, please.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Aye, sir. Descending.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: We'll divide into teams. Commanders Chekov and Uhura are assigned to the Uranium problem.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Ready sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Go, Mr. Sulu.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Maintaining impulse climb. Wing five by zero, helm steady.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Advise reaching 10,000. Steer three-one-zero.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Three-one-zero, aye!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Uhura, scan for the whales. 401 megahertz!

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: 10,000 M.S.L., Admiral.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Wing to cruise configuration... Full impulse power.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Aye, sir... Three-one-zero to the Bering Sea. E.T.A.: 12 minutes.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: 10 seconds, sir!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Hover on my mark, Mr. Sulu! Mr. Chekov, stand by de-cloaking -- Scotty, ready for power build up!  Mark, Mr. Sulu...

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: I have no control, sir!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Picture, Uhura!

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Sir -- I've got some back pressure on manual --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Ground cushion! Keep the nose up if you can --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Let's see what she's got, Mr. Sulu.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Aye, sir!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Systems report.  Communications?

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Communications Systems ready. Communications Officer -- ready as she'll ever be.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Sulu?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What is it?

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Overlapping distress calls. Some from Starships... others...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: On screen!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Then, this is what it would sound like underwater?

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Admiral, I am receiving whale songs.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: On speakers.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Individual whale song getting stronger... This is strange, Admiral. The song is directly ahead. It's coming from San Francisco.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: From a city? That doesn't make sense....

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: I'll have bearing and distance for you, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Right.  Now look: I want you all to be very careful. This is terra incognita. Many customs will doubtless take us by surprise. It's a forgone conclusion these people have never seen an extra-terrestrial before.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: We'll stick together till we get orientated. Bearing to the whales?

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: 283 degrees... 15.2 kilometers...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Everyone remember where we parked.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Any luck...?

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Nothing... I should never have left him...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Uhura, you did what was necessary.  Keep trying. You'll find him...

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: I've found Chekov, sir: he's in emergency surgery right now.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Uhura!... Where!

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Mercy Hospital.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Bearing!

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Bearing 327, range 600 nautical.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Put them on screen!

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Admiral, I have a signal closing on the whales. Bearing 328 degrees.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: On screen.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Estimate range, ship to whales!

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Sir... Estimating one nautical mile.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Unidentified aircraft, 40,000 feet MSL, range 30 miles, bearing 010.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Scott -- how soon?

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: I can't, sir -- Nothing!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Out of control, and blind as a bat!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Scott, how soon can we get underway?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Give me one more day, sir. The damage control is easy. Reading Klingon is hard.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: We're ready, sir. I've converted the Dilithium Sequencer to something less primitive. And Admiral -- I've replaced the Klingon Food Packs. They was givin' me sour stomach.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Appreciated by all, Mr. Scott.  Prepare for departure.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Scotty, how long is this bay?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: About 60 feet, Admiral.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: That should be enough. Can you enclose it to hold water?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: I suppose I can, sir; are you planning to take a swim?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Scotty, we have to find some Humpbacks.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Humpbacked - people.?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Whales, Scotty. 45 to 50 feet long; about 40 tons a piece.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Admiral - how am I going to handle all that weight?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You'll work it out, Scotty. And remember: two of them.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Two?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: It takes two to tango, Mr. Scott.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: They're giving out. De-crystallizing.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Give me a round figure, Mr. Scott.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Oh, twenty-four hours, give or take, staying cloaked. After that, Admiral, we'll be visible -- and dead in the water. In any case, we won't have enough to break out of the Earth's gravity, to say nothing of getting back home.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I can't believe we've come this far only to be stopped by this!  Scotty, is there any way dilithium can be re-crystallized?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Sorry, sir. We can't even do that in the 23rd Century.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What is it? I thought I told you never to call me --

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Sorry, Admiral. We just thought you'll like to know, we're beaming them now.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Oh I see --  Tell Them phasers on stun. Good luck. Kirk out.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: It's going slow, sir. It'll be well into tomorrow.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Not good enough, Scotty. You've got to do better!

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: I'll try, sir. Scott out.  Well now, he's got himself in a bit of a snit, don't he.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: I'm ready Spock. Let's go find George and Gracie...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Sulu?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Scotty: Are the whale tanks secure?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Aye. But I've never beamed up 400 tons before.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Stay with me, sir -- I need more power curve...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: How long, Scotty?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: 10 seconds, Admiral; 5 - 4 - 3 - 2 - 1.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Admiral! There be whales here!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Well done, Mr. Scott. How soon can we be ready for warp speed?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: I'll have to re-energize.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Don't take too long. We're sitting ducks for their radar systems...  Mr. Sulu, impulse climb.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Stand by, sir. Miracle worker at work...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Scott, don't make jokes, we are in danger of -

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Full power, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Sulu, if you please.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Ironic. When man was killing these creatures, he was destroying his own future...

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: The beasties seem happy to see you, Doctor. I hope you like our little aquarium.

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: You better get up there, sir. We're having some power fall-off...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: On my way...!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: The whales...?!

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: No power to the bay doors.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: The explosive override -- ?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: It's under water! There's no way to reach it...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Go on ahead... Close the hatch!

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Admiral, you'll be trapped!

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Excelsior? Why in God's name would you want that bucket of bolts?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Scotty, don't prejudge. A ship is a ship.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Admiral, I'd like to continue my work on the ship until you leave.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Thank you, Lt. Saavik.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: And... Here is a deposition I have made. If it is not sufficient, I will return to Earth to testify.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Don't concern yourself, Saavik. Your leave has been granted for good and proper cause.  How are you feeling?

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: I am well, Admiral.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You will be in good hands here.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Well, Saavik. I guess this is goodbye.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Yes, Admiral.  Sir. I have not had the opportunity to tell you about your son.  David died most bravely. He saved Spock. He saved us all... I thought you should know.

turns.speaker: KLINGON AMBASSADOR
turns.text: Even as the Federation negotiated a peace treaty with us, Kirk was secretly developing the Genesis torpedo! Conceived by Kirk's son and test detonated by the Admiral himself!  The result of this awesome energy was euphemistically called "The Genesis Planet..." A secret base from which to launch the. annihilation of the Klingon people!  We demand the extradition of Kirk! We demand justice!

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: Klingon justice is a unique point of view, Mr. President.

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: Genesis was perfectly named: The creation of life not death. It was the Klingons who had first blood while trying to possess its secrets.

turns.speaker: KLINGON AMBASSADOR
turns.text: Vulcans are well known as the intellectual puppets of the Federation!

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: Your vessel did destroy U.S.S. Grissom. Your men did kill Kirk's son. Do you deny these events?

turns.speaker: KLINGON AMBASSADOR
turns.text: We deny nothing! We have the right to preserve our race!

turns.speaker: SAREK
turns.text: Do you have the right to murder?

turns.speaker: SCOTTY
turns.text: Don't know anything about it? I find it difficult to believe that I've come millions of miles --

turns.speaker: NICHOLS
turns.text: Millions?
